intro: Omphalea biglandulosa, commonly known as the biglandular moonseed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by distinctive, three-lobed fruits. It thrives in moist, wooded areas and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
